commands.description: Initializes a new Rust project with the specified name, setting up a directory and necessary Rust files.
Compiles the Rust project along with its dependencies, producing executables or libraries.
Builds and executes the main binary of the Rust project, commonly used for development testing.
Runs the Rust project's test suite, including unit, doc, and integration tests.
Analyzes the Rust project to report errors, without compiling the project into executables.
Cleans up the Rust project by removing the target directory and its compiled artifacts.
Generates documentation for the Rust project and its dependencies.
Updates the Rust project's dependencies based on the Cargo.lock file.
Runs performance benchmarks defined in the Rust project.
Packages and uploads the Rust project to crates.io, Rust's package registry.
Installs a Rust crate as a binary, making it available for use system-wide.
